results.title: Over the Andes in Ecuador
results.creator_credit: Public Media and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: The major difficulties restricting Ecuador’s development are illustrated by the journey of a crate to a tiny village in the Amazon Basin. Also shows the standard of living, and the differences between the cities of Guayaquil and Quito. (Edited version of an Institut fur Film und Bild, Munich film.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Public Media and Institut für Film und Bild

results.title: Over in the meadow
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: For generations children have sung and loved this gay, counting song in which flowers, animals and birds, mothers and babies have provided the delightful setting for a lesson in numbers and nature. In this version lively vignettes in stunning colours make ideal company for the rhythmic pattern of the text.

results.title: Over in 3 weeks
results.creator_credit: Tom Ross, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Once Tom Ross and his fellow soldiers settled in Singapore, the bombing started. In three weeks, they were captured and sent to Changi, where Ross was a prisoner of war for three and a half years. Despite the abject conditions, Ross managed to survive through sheer determination and will to live.

results.title: Over here: Irish music and dance in England
results.creator_credit: Carlo Gebler, Iain Bruce and Associates Film Productions
results.brief_description: Uses archive film to explain why so many Irish-born people live in Britain and records examples of the Irish tradition at work there. Reveals the rich tradition of music, song and dance which the Irish have brought with them to Britain.

results.title: Over by Christmas, 1914
results.brief_description: Part of the Time to remember series. Deals with the year 1914 in Western Europe and the outbreak of hostilities in World War I. Includes images of Prince Albert, King George, King Wilheim, Queen Mary, Nicholas (Czar of Russia), the President of France and archival footage.

results.title: Over-the-counter pills and promises
results.creator_credit: Lee Rhoads, Alfred Higgins and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: Shows that highly advertised over-the-counter medicines may not offer the best values and that less expensive brands and home remedies are often just as effective.

results.title: Over-the-counter drugs: smooth talk & small print (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Larry Stein, Barr Films and Vision Films
results.brief_description: Analyses the claims and promises of TV commercials for non-prescription drugs. It points out that the small print on product labels contains information about ingredients and dosages as well as warnings about adverse reactions that could occur. Stresses the danger of mixing drugs and drinking alcohol while taking drugs. Encourages people to talk to their pharmacist.

results.title: Over-dependency
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The case history of a man whose life is crippled by behavior patterns carried over from a too-dependent childhood. Through therapy he comes to understand the causes of his illness and fear.

results.title: Ouyen's Roxy Theatre
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Roxy Theatre in Ouyen was under threat of becoming an abandoned ruin until the community stepped in to save it. Originally opened in 1936, it eventually became one of the only tropical theatres in the southern region of Australia but was closed in 1971 due to the actions of rowdy youths (according to local myth). After 36 years of closure, Jenny Heaslip took on the challenge of restoring the theatre and rallied over 250 local volunteers to help her. It is now an integral meeting point for the people of Ouyen not only because of fortnightly film screenings, but for community events, launches and celebrations. Run on a shoestring budget The Roxy continues to rely upon volunteers and community fundraising to stay alive.

results.title: Outward bound to adventure
results.brief_description: The Outward Bound School in Malaya. Boys aged between 15 and 25 years are given valuable character training through planned outdoor activities which call primarily for physical fitness, self-reliance, initiative and teamwork. The film shows how Kim Seng, a young Malayan factory worker, benefits from a course at the school.
